result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Kenneth Ostman

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Exhibit 1 from preliminary hearing - Certified Record from DMV

10:19 AM Defendant Richard Kenneth Ostman in court, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Richard Kenneth Ostman.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Court notes trailing citation. Pleads not guilty, ask for matter to trail. Court accepts plea. State calls witness, Patrol Officer Seth Noll, S/T. State-direct examination of witness. September 30, 2022, City of Superior, Douglas County Wisconsin, Kwik Trip. Officer Brown also involved. Witness identifies Defendant, no response by Attorney Nelson. Record reflects identification of defendant. 
No cross exam. 
Exhibit 1 marked. Exhibit 1 offered (driving record). Moves for admission, no objection. Exhibit 1 received. State notes prior OWI convictions. 
State rests.
State makes argument for bind over. Attorney makes argument in opposition. Court finds probable cause and binds the Defendant over for Arraignment. 
Court reminds the Defendant of their bail conditions. Defendant orally confirms they have received date and time of hearing and confirms they will attend. Defendant provided notice.
Arraignment scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. No use or possession of alcohol.

3:02 PM Defendant Richard Kenneth Ostman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid in court for Richard Kenneth Ostman.  Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's address confirmed. Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint, waives a formal reading, and requests a preliminary hearing. State asks for $7500 cash. No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. No use or possession of alcohol. State notes this is an 8th offense. State recites previous criminal convictions and FTAs in those cases. Attorney Reid notes that he is a lifelong resident of the county and has family in the county. Is currently on SSI. Asks for $1,000 cash bond, which is the maximum defendant can post.  
Court notes concerns over recent FTAs and potential penalties of the offense. 
Court orders $3,000 cash. No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. No use or possession of alcohol.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
